Update openstack-on-lxd section for s390x

Also update doc to use openstack-client commands.

Change-Id: I6fcadec052a13e97343bf6232be2e960bbd7bc24
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-guide refs/changes/59/404459/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: python-neutronclient python-openstackclient curlFor amd64 Mitaka: juju deploy bundle-mitaka.yaml For s390x Mitaka: juju deploy bundle-mitaka-s390x.yaml For s390x Newton: .. code:: bash juju deploy bundle-newton-s390x.yaml For ppc64el (PowerNV) Mitaka: openstack keypair create --public-key ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub mykey Create Flavors ++++++++++++++ It's safe to skip this for Mitaka. For Newton and later, there are no pre-populated flavors. Check if flavors exist, and if not, create them: .. code:: bash openstack flavor list .. code:: bash openstack flavor create --public --ram 512 --disk 1 --ephemeral 0 --vcpus 1 m1.tiny openstack flavor create --public --ram 1024 --disk 20 --ephemeral 40 --vcpus 1 m1.small openstack flavor create --public --ram 2048 --disk 40 --ephemeral 40 --vcpus 2 m1.medium openstack flavor create --public --ram 8192 --disk 40 --ephemeral 40 --vcpus 4 m1.large openstack flavor create --public --ram 16384 --disk 80 --ephemeral 40 --vcpus 8 m1.xlarge
deleted_lines: python-neutronclient python-openstackclientFor amd64 installs: juju deploy bundle.yaml For s390x: juju deploy bundle-s390x.yaml For ppc64el (PowerNV): nova keypair-add --pub-key ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub mykey

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

b'https://gist.github.com/98c7444b0b7433752d2d0af01eb11924\n'

Change-Id: I211f284679c345f82e39202906200490bc96a1dc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-specs refs/changes/73/402473/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ======================== Team and repository tags ======================== .. image:: http://governance.openstack.org/badges/oslo-specs.svg :target: http://governance.openstack.org/reference/tags/index.html .. Change things from this point on

HPELeftHandISCSIDriver support for Cinder

Cinder configuration with HPELeftHandISCSIDriver
for VSA storage

added_lines: heat_template_version: 2015-10-15 description: Configure hieradata for Cinder HPELeftHandISCSI Storage configuration parameters: server: description: ID of the controller node to apply this config to type: string # Config specific parameters, to be provided via parameter_defaults CinderEnableHPELeftHandISCSIBackend: type: boolean default: true CinderHPELeftHandISCSIApiUrl: type: string CinderHPELeftHandISCSIUserName: type: string CinderHPELeftHandISCSIPassword: type: string hidden: true CinderHPELeftHandISCSIBackendName: type: string default: 'tripleo_hpelefthand' CinderHPELeftHandISCSIDriver: type: string default: 'cinder.volume.drivers.hpe.hpe_lefthand_iscsi.HPELeftHandISCSIDriver' CinderHPELeftHandISCSIChapEnabled: type: boolean default: false CinderHPELeftHandClusterName: type: boolean CinderHPELeftHandDebug: type: boolean default: false resources: CinderHPELeftHandISCSIConfig: type: OS::Heat::StructuredConfig properties: group: os-apply-config config: hiera: datafiles: cinder_hpelefthand_data: mapped_data: tripleo::profile::base::cinder::volume::cinder_enable_hpelefthand_backend: {get_input: EnableHPELeftHandISCSIBackend} cinder::backend::hpelefthand_iscsi::hpelefthand_api_url: {get_input: HPELeftHandISCSIApiUrl} cinder::backend::hpelefthand_iscsi::hpelefthand_username: {get_input: HPELeftHandISCSIUserName} cinder::backend::hpelefthand_iscsi::hpelefthand_password: {get_input: HPELeftHandISCSIPassword} cinder::backend::hpelefthand_iscsi::volume_backend_name: {get_input: HPELeftHandISCSIBackendName} cinder::backend::hpelefthand_iscsi::volume_driver: {get_input: HPELeftHandISCSIDriver} cinder::backend::hpelefthand_iscsi::hpelefthand_iscsi_chap_enabled: {get_input: HPELeftHandISCSIChapEnabled} cinder::backend::hpelefthand_iscsi::hpelefthand_clustername: {get_input: HPELeftHandClusterName} cinder::backend::hpelefthand_iscsi::hpelefthand_debug: {get_input: HPELeftHandDebug} subject: Refactoring agent metadata config
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-22 18:09:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/bf73cd6264191f819458233b14659484058cf21d', 'message': 'Refactoring agent metadata config

Refactoring neutron agent metadata config opts to be in
neutron/conf/agent/metadata so that all the configurations options
reside in a centralized location. This simplifies the process of looking
up the config opts and provides an easy way to import.

Change-Id: I8bae1facc58a4f9e21196f625478532403651545

Partial-Bug: #1563069
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-02 00:14:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/f2ea0fac16a3f2bdfe19c87c28121c6ac843013a', 'message': 'Refactoring agent metadata config

Refactoring neutron agent metadata config opts to be in
neutron/conf/agent/metadata so that all the configurations options

commit_message:
Refactoring agent metadata config

Refactoring neutron agent metadata config opts to be in
neutron/conf/agent/metadata so that all the configurations options
reside in a centralized location. This simplifies the process of looking
up the config opts and provides an easy way to import.

Change-Id: I8bae1facc58a4f9e21196f625478532403651545
Partial-Bug: #1563069
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/62/346162/18 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.conf.agent.metadata import config

Closes-bug: #1646046

commit_message:
Use default jdk in devstack setup

Currlent searchlight devstack plugin installs openjdk7 for
ubuntu, which may not exist on some distribution(16.04).
Replace openjdk-7-headless with default-jdk-headless.

Change-Id: Iabbadf1ee2788109f75a56066cea5dc337d161de
Closes-bug: #1646046
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/searchlight refs/changes/84/404784/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: is_package_installed default-jdk-headless || install_package default-jdk-headless

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

https://gist.github.com/07f6a80997cf488c0019cab45b21288e

Change-Id: Iaa4a0ef74826cb9276300017b2bf4437d96f70fb

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

b'https://gist.github.com/65852673eba54e723401f2ef049673b2\n'

Change-Id: Ied7ae786a47a2b523e68bd7c9d6554e9822a95a3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/85/402585/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Point roles docs bugs to openstack-ansible LP

Currently when clicking on the small bug in the roles'
docs, we land on openstack-manuals launchpad.

This should solve it.

Change-Id: I201da22af67ecee2b4829e2c545da8a6164d4504
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-apt_package_pinning refs/changes/96/405296/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # A few variables have to be set for the log-a-bug feature. # giturl: The location of conf.py on Git. Must be set manually. # gitsha: The SHA checksum of the bug description. Automatically extracted from git log. # bug_tag: Tag for categorizing the bug. Must be set manually. # These variables are passed to the logabug code via html_context. giturl = ("http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/{0}" "/tree/doc/source").format(target_name) git_cmd = "/usr/bin/git log | head -n1 | cut -f2 -d' '" gitsha = os.popen(git_cmd).read().strip('\n') bug_project = project.lower() bug_title = "Documentation bug" html_context = {"gitsha": gitsha, "giturl": giturl, "bug_tag": "docs", "bug_title": bug_title, "bug_project": bug_project }

commit_message:
Increase the judgment of the state of the cinder volume

When restore cinder by cinder, create volume from image,
but the image is missing without the judgment for volume.
This patch fix it.

Change-Id: I1657d3cad8c05499f9e09e9e63b8aee60d337fd3
Closes-Bug: #1583497

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-01 09:47:46.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/upgrade/upgrade.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector/commit/5de0c24676a30815d324959084917ad40e700a12', 'message': 'Do not source old/localrc twise in grenade

By sourcing localrc second time we try to enable ironic plugin
one more time witch is not allowed by [0]

This patch checks if ironic was enabled or not in base environment
without sourcing localrc.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/396794/

Change-Id: I432c243c66c0d11adcf4c6568968fbeaaf9acdcd
'}]
commit_message:
Do not source old/localrc twise in grenade

By sourcing localrc second time we try to enable ironic plugin
one more time witch is not allowed by [0]

This patch checks if ironic was enabled or not in base environment
without sourcing localrc.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/396794/

Change-Id: I432c243c66c0d11adcf4c6568968fbeaaf9acdcd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector refs/changes/33/405233/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Deterine whether we're "upgrading" from another compute driver # read localrc from the end, pick only first match _ironic_old_driver=$( tac $BASE_DEVSTACK_DIR/localrc |grep -m 1 VIRT_DRIVER | awk -F '=' '{print $2}')
deleted_lines: # Determine whether we're "upgrading" from another compute driver _ironic_old_driver=$(source $BASE_DEVSTACK_DIR/functions; source $BASE_DEVSTACK_DIR/localrc; echo $VIRT_DRIVER)

commit_message:
Fix 'Version is None' report for publisher

The local controller reports 'Version is None' for publisher table
consistently. But actually, the version of publisher is safe to
ignore as it is not versioned.

Change-Id: Iaf52d6117233a7d7de32d9a2dfbb1b82bcc44c26
Closes-Bug: #1646051
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/98/404698/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(nick-ma-z): The publisher table is ignored.
deleted_lines: 'publisher': {} elif table == 'publisher': if action == 'delete': self.controller.publisher_deleted(local_object.get_id()) else: self.controller.publisher_updated(df_object) elif table == 'publisher': df_objects = self.nb_api.get_publishers() local_objects = self.db_store.get_publishers() self._get_and_compare_df_and_local_data(table, direct)

subject: Hiera optimization: use a new hiera hook
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-11 01:17:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/cc4bb6141c6f9fc7eee99d47a6a1885c51748fc0', 'message': "Hiera optimization: use a new hiera hook

This patch optimizes how we deploy hiera by using a new
heat hook specifically designed to help compose hiera
within heat templates. As part of this change:

 - we update all the 'hiera' software configurations to set the group to hiera
   instead of os-apply-config.

 - The new format uses JSON instead of YAML. The hook actually writes
   out the hiera JSON directly so no conversion takes place. Arrays,
   Strings, Booleans all stay in their native formats. As such we can avoid
   having to do many of the awkward string and list conversions in t-h-t to
   support the previous YAML formatting.

 - The new hook prefers JSON over YAML so upgrading users will have the
   new files prefered. (we will post a cleanup routine for the old files
   soon but this isn't a new behavior, JSON is now simply prefered.)

 - A lot of services required edits to account for default settings that
   worked in YAML that no longer work correctly in the native JSON
   format. In almost all these cases I think the resulting codes looks
   cleaner and is more explicit with regards to what is getting
   configured in hiera on the actual nodes.

Change-Id: Ibe7e2044e200e2c947223286fdf4fd5bcf98c2e1
Depends-On: I4132c39491993afc5c1d1415b8b27874312af123
Closes-bug: #1596373

heat hook specifically designed to help compose hiera
within heat templates. As part of this change:

 - we update all the 'hiera' software configurations to set the group to hiera
   instead of os-apply-config.

 - The new format uses JSON instead of YAML. The hook actually writes
   out the hiera JSON directly so no conversion takes place. Arrays,
   Strings, Booleans all stay in their native formats. As such we can avoid
   having to do many of the awkward string and list conversions in t-h-t to
   support the previous YAML formatting.

 - The new hook prefers JSON over YAML so upgrading users will have the
   new files prefered. (we will post a cleanup routine for the old files
   soon but this isn't a new behavior, JSON is now simply prefered.)

 - A lot of services required edits to account for default settings that
   worked in YAML that no longer work correctly in the native JSON
   format. In almost all these cases I think the resulting codes looks
   cleaner and is more explicit with regards to what is getting
   configured in hiera on the actual nodes.

Change-Id: Ibe7e2044e200e2c947223286fdf4fd5bcf98c2e1
Depends-On: I21639f6aadabf9e49f40d1bb0b1d0edcfc4dbc5e
Depends-On: I21639f6aadabf9e49f40d1bb0b1d0edcfc4dbc5e
Depends-On: I4e1fbba05b7fbd581fccd20e9a9f6233f4aec9a5
Closes-bug: #1596373

commit_message:
Hiera optimization: use a new hiera hook

This patch optimizes how we deploy hiera by using a new
heat hook specifically designed to help compose hiera
within heat templates. As part of this change:

 - we update all the 'hiera' software configurations to set the group to hiera
   instead of os-apply-config.

 - The new format uses JSON instead of YAML. The hook actually writes
   out the hiera JSON directly so no conversion takes place. Arrays,
   Strings, Booleans all stay in their native formats. As such we can avoid
   having to do many of the awkward string and list conversions in t-h-t to
   support the previous YAML formatting.

 - The new hook prefers JSON over YAML so upgrading users will have the
   new files prefered. (we will post a cleanup routine for the old files
   soon but this isn't a new behavior, JSON is now simply prefered.)

 - A lot of services required edits to account for default settings that
   worked in YAML that no longer work correctly in the native JSON
   format. In almost all these cases I think the resulting codes looks
   cleaner and is more explicit with regards to what is getting
   configured in hiera on the actual nodes.

Depends-On: I6a383b1ad4ec29458569763bd3f56fd3f2bd726b
Closes-bug: #1596373

Change-Id: Ibe7e2044e200e2c947223286fdf4fd5bcf98c2e1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/57/384757/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: neutron::service_plugins: {get_param: NeutronServicePlugins}
deleted_lines: neutron::service_plugins: str_replace: template: PLUGINS params: PLUGINS: {get_param: NeutronServicePlugins}

commit_message:
Install hiera orc files via install.d

Now that we've landed the overcloud-agent element this seems
to be required to make the hiera-disable script work correctly again.

Should help make Ibe7e2044e200e2c947223286fdf4fd5bcf98c2e1 pass
again too...

Change-Id: I6a383b1ad4ec29458569763bd3f56fd3f2bd726b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-puppet-elements refs/changes/75/405075/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash set -eux set -o pipefail mkdir -p /usr/libexec/os-refresh-config/configure.d/ install -m 0755 -o root -g root $(dirname $0)/../10-hiera-disable /usr/libexec/os-refresh-config/configure.d/10-hiera-disable install -m 0755 -o root -g root $(dirname $0)/../40-hiera-datafiles /usr/libexec/os-refresh-config/configure.d/40-hiera-datafiles

subject: Add python-heat-agent-ansible to overcloud images.

commit_message:
[huawei]Add a option to adjust the lun-copy speed

Add a option 'lun_copy_speed' between 1 to 4, so
that we can determine the speed from slow to fastest.

Change-Id: I23ae1f1c8a984dd44a159bf9f9990e64d72eed85
Closes-bug: #1646019

commit_message:
Install ansible with OpenStack requirements constrains

OpenStack requirements constrains is well tested. Use it in case of
installing upstream broken package.

This also fixes latest requests 2.12.2 break docker-py, which makes
kolla gate red.

Change-Id: I3e4ec4af2a6e1280313733e8f31f2eea7669dbc1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/73/405273/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: GIT_PROJECT_DIR=$(mktemp -d) function clone_repos { dest: ${GIT_PROJECT_DIR}/kolla - name: openstack/requirements dest: ${GIT_PROJECT_DIR}/requirements openstack/kolla openstack/requirements } function build_image { pushd "${GIT_PROJECT_DIR}/kolla" sudo -H pip install -U -c ${GIT_PROJECT_DIR}/requirements/upper-constraints.txt "ansible>=2" "docker-py>=1.6.0" "python-openstackclient" "python-neutronclient" sudo pip install -c ${GIT_PROJECT_DIR}/requirements/upper-constraints.txt araclone_repos
deleted_lines: function build_image { KOLLA_DIR=$(mktemp -d) dest: ${KOLLA_DIR} openstack/kolla pushd "${KOLLA_DIR}" sudo -H pip install -U "ansible>=2" "docker-py>=1.6.0" "python-openstackclient" "python-neutronclient" sudo pip install ara

commit_message:
Source devstack openrc only one time

Recently sourcing of openrc in each function
started to break gates because of sharing
of openrc variables between gate scripts

This commit sources openrc only one time
in top scope

Closes-Bug: #1646448
Change-Id: I51d2f7434a4d72207ee0402e0f1fc335dbec1afb

commit_message:
Introduce new validation rules for tags and roles

Change-Id: Ia45c81a46e9323faa6471438acbfa6d65d01b7f4
Implements: blueprint role-decomposition
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/25/399625/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nailgun import objects self.cluster = self.env.create(api=False, nodes_kwargs=[ {'roles': ['controller'], 'pending_addition': True}, {'roles': ['controller'], 'pending_addition': True}, {'roles': ['controller'], 'pending_addition': True}]) objects.Cluster.set_primary_tags(self.cluster, self.cluster.nodes) self.release = self.cluster.release self.tag_data = {'name': 'my_tag', 'meta': {'has_primary': True}} role = self.env.get_role(owner_type, self.cluster.release.id, 'controller').json role['meta']['tags'].append(self.tag_data['name']) self.env.update_role(owner_type, self.release.id, 'controller', role) self.env.create_role('clusters', self.cluster.id, role) objects.Cluster.set_primary_tags(self.cluster, self.cluster.nodes) self.assertNotIn(self.tag_data['name'], self.cluster.roles_metadata['controller']['tags']) for node in self.cluster.nodes: self.assertNotIn(self.tag_data['name'], node) self.cluster = self.env.create(api=False, nodes_kwargs=[ {'roles': ['controller'], 'pending_addition': True}, {'roles': ['controller'], 'pending_addition': True}, {'roles': ['controller'], 'pending_addition': True}]) objects.Cluster.set_primary_tags(self.cluster, self.cluster.nodes) self.tag_data = {'name': 'my_tag', 'meta': {'has_primary': True}} self.release = self.cluster.release role = self.env.get_role('releases', self.release.id, 'controller').json role['meta']['tags'].append(self.tag_data['name']) self.env.create_role(owner_type, self.cluster.id, role) objects.Cluster.set_primary_tags(self.cluster, self.cluster.nodes) self.assertNotIn(self.tag_data['name'], self.cluster.roles_metadata['controller']['tags']) for node in self.cluster.nodes: self.assertNotIn(self.tag_data['name'], node.primary_tags)
deleted_lines: self.release = self.env.create_release() self.tag_data = {'name': 'my_tag', 'meta': {'has_primary': False}} self.cluster = self.env.create_cluster(api=False) self.tag_data = {'name': 'my_tag', 'meta': {'has_primary': False}}

commit_message:
Point roles docs bugs to openstack-ansible LP

Currently when clicking on the small bug in the roles'
docs, we land on openstack-manuals launchpad.

This should solve it.

Change-Id: I00d33aa1705937813ea8151cc096bc945a6d0428
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/40/405340/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # gitsha: The SHA checksum of the bug description. Automatically extracted from git log. # bug_tag: Tag for categorizing the bug. Must be set manually. # These variables are passed to the logabug code via html_context. giturl = ("http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/{0}" "/tree/doc/source").format(target_name) git_cmd = "/usr/bin/git log | head -n1 | cut -f2 -d' '" gitsha = os.popen(git_cmd).read().strip('\n') bug_project = project.lower() bug_title = "Documentation bug" html_context = {"gitsha": gitsha, "giturl": giturl, "bug_tag": "docs", "bug_title": bug_title, "bug_project": bug_project } # A few variables have to be set for the log-a-bug feature. # giturl: The location of conf.py on Git. Must be set manually.

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

b'https://gist.github.com/4f7ebfa0c85e8007a41d4bc5c8f4ec97\n'

Change-Id: If173ce9a047c6df285283a735ce15a90d4f7cea3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstackdocstheme refs/changes/12/402612/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ======================== Team and repository tags ======================== .. image:: http://governance.openstack.org/badges/openstackdocstheme.svg :target: http://governance.openstack.org/reference/tags/index.html .. Change things from this point on

commit_message:
Fix help messages for update commands

Help messages for the host-update and lease-update commands were wrongly
referring to delete rather than update.

Change-Id: I489a30ec04e98e557256f8ad30757e9be82f22f1
Closes-Bug: #1643765
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-blazarclient refs/changes/21/400521/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: help_str = 'ID or name of %s to update' else: help_str = 'ID of %s to update'
deleted_lines: help_str = 'ID or name of %s to delete' else: help_str = 'ID of %s to delete'

commit_message:
Add ability to add options to ansible-lint run

We may need to ignore some upstream repositories/roles that don't abide
by the ansible-lint rules that we use.

This patch adds the ability to add options to "ansible-lint" run, for
example "--exclude <repo>", to exclude certain repositories from lint
checks.

Change-Id: I4dc9f93470aeb27f8859b581a3619e1386525f27
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests refs/changes/91/405291/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export LINT_OPTS=${LINT_OPTS:-""}ansible-lint ${LINT_OPTS} ${WORKING_DIR}

commit_message:
Update scheduler config options

The scheduler and scheduler filter options have been moved out of the
DEFAULT name space to scheduler and filter_scheduler namespaces. This
change updates the configuration namespace for the existing
configuration options, removes the DEFAULT version and adds additional
configuration options.

Change-Id: I8f1da7546bf6aa20bb2cb17d3c8163963ef32e2a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/05/391305/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'scheduler/driver': value => $scheduler_driver;

commit_message:
Fix puppet/services/README.rst step description

We removed Step 6 in Iae33149e4a03cd64c5831e689be8189ad0cf034b
but forgot to update the README.  Similarly we made all roles
use the same steps in Ia2ea559e8eeb64763908f75705e3728ee90b5744
so the comment is no longer true.

Change-Id: If5482ebd22a2547ed2165199992840a0dcacb04c

commit_message:
Add a release note for HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware

Change-Id: I0815c0fff4f99ea979a4f6883d10eaf2e7c77907
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/56/405256/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - Ceilometer sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Ceilometer. The purpose of this middleware is to set up the request URL correctly in case there is a proxy (for instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy) in front of Ceilometer. So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the proxy, and one tries to get the versions from the / resource of Ceilometer, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will show 'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases. Thus helping Keystone discovery work correctly. The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a configuration value.

subject: Metering: sync only active routers hosted on the same host
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-12 07:42:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/0dcd3583ae104e8d46688e4bcb4d40683c112338', 'message': "Metering: sync only active routers hosted on the same host

When syncing data from neutron server, metering-agent may receive
information about routers that are not hosted by the l3-agent on the
same host, because the server didn't filter them out. This could lead to
the following problems:
  * metering-agent tries to setup iptables rules for a router that is not
    on the host
  * metering-agent tries to get get traffic counters for a router that
    was once on the host but is already removed
  * metering-agent not sets up iptables rules for a router that is
    removed then added back to the host, because nothing about the
    router is changed from metering-agent's perspective

This commit fixes the aforementioned problems by making metering-agent
only receive information about routers that are on the same host, and
update metering-agent's knowledge about which routers it should care.

However, there could still be problem if one removes then adds a router
back to the same l3-agent, or just sets the router's admin_state_up
property to False then True in a short time(shorter than the interval
between two syncs). Because the metering-agent sees nothing changed
while during the same time the router's namespace is removed and added
back on the host. Thus metering-agent will fail to get such router's
traffic counters. This commit also make iptables-driver to forget such
routers and leave the metering-agent to reconfigure them later.

Closes-Bug: #1580548

Change-Id: Ia6ae82c676582b06710d6f96b9938c215258182d
Signed-off-by: Hunt Xu <mhuntxu@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Metering: sync only active routers hosted on the same host

When syncing data from neutron server, metering-agent may receive
information about routers that are not hosted by the l3-agent on the
same host, because the server didn't filter them out. This could lead to
the following problems:
  * metering-agent tries to setup iptables rules for a router that is not
    on the host
  * metering-agent tries to get get traffic counters for a router that
    was once on the host but is already removed
  * metering-agent not sets up iptables rules for a router that is
    removed then added back to the host, because nothing about the
    router is changed from metering-agent's perspective

This commit fixes the aforementioned problems by making metering-agent
only receive information about routers that are on the same host, and
update metering-agent's knowledge about which routers it should care.

However, there could still be problem if one removes then adds a router
back to the same l3-agent, or just sets the router's admin_state_up
property to False then True in a short time(shorter than the interval
between two syncs). Because the metering-agent sees nothing changed
while during the same time the router's namespace is removed and added
back on the host. Thus metering-agent will fail to get such router's
traffic counters. This commit also make iptables-driver to forget such
routers and leave the metering-agent to reconfigure them later.

Closes-Bug: #1580548

Change-Id: Ia6ae82c676582b06710d6f96b9938c215258182d
Signed-off-by: Hunt Xu <mhuntxu@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/89/315389/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: routers_to_reconfigure = [] routers_to_reconfigure.append(router['id']) for router_id in routers_to_reconfigure: self.routers.pop(router_id, None)

commit_message:
Delete redundant clean code

Tests test create and delete an aggregate, they will call delete
function in the end of the testcase, and in wait_for_resource_deletion
funtion will verify is_resource_deleted, so addcleanup is redundant.
Delete them for the code clean.

Change-Id: I59fde84b672aa365c58670bc3748ddba266ac13f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/07/404707/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: k8s_ironic: fix minion template

commit_message:
Change _get_pci_dev_list func

Add hostname check and run lshw only on bootstrap nodes.
Add sanitize param to lshw to hide any ip,mac etc

Change-Id: I7739da68ab059178787ff0fe2418a54717684750
Closes-Bug: #1554970
(cherry picked from commit b8a2f95f0f85806de885da4d9e0483296b6c0def)

commit_message:
List comprehensions

Replace some unnecessarily iterative/functional idioms with more
Pythonic ones.

Also eliminate duplication between find_config_dirs and
find_config_files.

Change-Id: I678a7b072d195be9a4271dc5b2a9b5c300098cb0

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/46/403646/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _Upgrading-by-using-a-script: =========================== Upgrading by using a script =========================== The upgrade script is still under active development. Do *not* run itTo upgrade from |previous_release_formal_name| to |current_release_formal_name| by using the upgrade script, perform the following steps in the ``openstack-ansible`` directory: #. Change directory to the repository clone root directory: .. code-block:: console # cd /opt/openstack-ansible #. Run the following commands: .. parsed-literal:: # git checkout |latest_tag| # ./scripts/run-upgrade.sh
deleted_lines: .. _script-upgrade: ======================== Upgrading using a script ======================== The upgrade script is still under active development and should not be runTo upgrade from |previous_release_formal_name| to |current_release_formal_name| using the upgrade script, perform the following steps in the ``openstack-ansible`` directoy: .. parsed-literal:: # git checkout |latest_tag| # ./scripts/run-upgrade.sh

However, in the firewall of l2 agent, ports are identified by 'device'

But for other agent, like linuxbridge agent, the 'device' attribute of

commit_message:
Fix security_groups_provider_updated for linuxbridge

According to [1], security_groups_provider_updated will get port ids
to update the related security groups.

However, in the firewall of l2 agent, ports are identified by 'device'
attribute. This is fine for ovs agent, because, for ovs agent, port id
is the same as 'device' attribute.

But for other agent, like linuxbridge agent, the 'device' attribute of
port will be the device name. This will make l2 agent can't find port
and fail to update the security group of port. The info message at [2]
can be observed.

The fix is to convert port id list to 'device' list.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/neutron/tree/neutron/db/securitygroups_rpc_base.py#n157
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/neutron/tree/neutron/agent/linux/iptables_firewall.py#n177

Change-Id: Idf9bd7942ef2063cfbc5e9eeead8d49d09883ea8
Closes-Bug: #1555027
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/90/312890/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if devices_to_update is None: # Update all devices if self.defer_refresh_firewall: self.refresh_firewall() else: devices = [] for device in self.firewall.ports.values(): # neutron server will give port id for updated, change it to # device name in firewall, so that the L2 agent can consume it if device['id'] in devices_to_update: devices.append(device['device']) if self.defer_refresh_firewall: self.devices_to_refilter |= set(devices) else: self.refresh_firewall(devices)
deleted_lines: if self.defer_refresh_firewall: if devices_to_update is None: self.devices_to_refilter |= set(devices_to_update) else: self.refresh_firewall(devices_to_update)

commit_message:
Handle ImageNotFound when building an instance

When building an instance, if the glance client throws
an ImageNotFound exception the compute manager will
reschedule the instance without cleaning up any
networks that have been built out, leaking any ports
that have been created.

The correct behaviour should include cleaning up allocated
networks and abandoning the instance creation, leaving it
in error.

Change-Id: I662d932a5f2345e42b4178d54062b50b79fdbb72
Closes-bug: #1632042

commit_message:
Update ref for puppet-heat

Current keystone in Mitaka has case sensitive check for domain_ids,
and puppet-heat module (tag 8.2.0) configures domain_ids which are
now incorrect from Keystone point of view.

This commit updates ref of puppet-heat module in order to consume
commit which contains proper settings for domain ids and name

Change-Id: I3ae01cc392894e5a582eec5be017a158bd53d24b
Closes-Bug: #1644584

commit_message:
devstack: configure tempest at test-config stage

We need to follow devstack change I3d98692e69d94756e0034c83a247e05d85177f02 or
our tempest config addition comes before the config is completely
reset by devstack tempest setup (lib/tempest:configure_tempest rm -rf at [1]).

[1] https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/0474b8384ac937591e42d3cb91b5a4292ab6ab8f/lib/tempest#L177

Change-Id: I024effd277b90c20c17ae09d291cbadfe5c03f57

commit_message:
Add a release note for HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware

Change-Id: I0815c0fff4f99ea979a4f6883d10eaf2e7c77907
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/03/403803/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - Ceilometer sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Ceilometer. The purpose of this middleware is to set up the request URL correctly in case there is a proxy (for instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy) in front of Ceilometer. So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the proxy, and one tries to get the versions from the / resource of Ceilometer, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will show 'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases. Thus helping Keystone discovery work correctly. The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a configuration value.

'}]
commit_message:
use hyphen-less option name sql_expire_sample_only

One storage option defined as "sql-expire-sample-only", which
causes, when execute "ceilometer-upgrade", will get the
warning: Configuration option(s) 'sql_expire_samples_only' not
supported.

This is because sql_expire_sample_only is defined in ceilometer,
not oslo db. This option should be excluded before init database
session. Please refer to the similar situation in the commit:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/249921/1

In this change, update this option name to hyphen-less, to make
sure this option correctly excluded from cfg.CONF.database options.

Change-Id: Id2afe59ca9a7ab402c1df3a80fba6e715c64eb14

commit_message:
HPE3PAR: handle conflict in iscsi host create

One of the step in creating iSCSI VLUN is to create a host on array.
If there are simultaneous requests comming on 3par array for creating
same host, hpe3parclient creates host for first request and returns
HTTP 409 conflict error for others, with error code 73, message "host
WWN/iSCSI name already used by another host". This was not handled by
3PAR iscsi driver and the HTTP exception would propagate up to volume
manager where it would log it. This patch addresses issue by catching
this exception and reusing the same host.

Closes-Bug: #1642945
(cherry picked from commit 9b0c5c4318d3c348ce185a3f4dd94f9e803bf264)

Change-Id: I102409539c9a691c1816a342163dd049855f57da
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/10/403510/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add a default value of configuring option in plugin.sh

In patch [1], an option be created to determine whether "plugin update"
is supported. Set default value "False" of this option while installing
sahara.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/367129

Change-Id: I22f694a28eec5ae90512f9415c263b895a86fe23

commit_message:
Make the name of a Zaqar queue optional

There's no reason to force the user to specify the name of a Zaqar queue.
In fact, doing so makes it difficult for users to create multiple instance
of the same template without having all of the messages go into a single
queue (and without deleting the shared queue when one of the stacks is
deleted).

We now autogenerate a sensible randomised name if none is provided.

Change-Id: I5195d8c0dd413a8f1bd28c2a8ef7a3191c74f882
Partial-Bug: #1637304

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

https://gist.github.com/1122d16e18d83112132dd9b7e319d045

Change-Id: I4abd467da996c7a878939fce018ae9b8f311246c

Remove unused methods in nova virt driver

Remove the following:
* refresh_security_group_members
* refresh_provider_fw_rules

The methods above has been removed from nova, so it won't be
called anymore.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-30 15:32:34.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/zaqar/queue.py', 'heat/tests/openstack/zaqar/test_queue.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/015c3c228af962b1866fde46433b4d399522cd60', 'message': 'Don't return the signed queue URL from get_resource

A signed Zaqar queue URL is too long to fit as a physical resource ID.
The current queue URL is also very specific to Aodh, and likely won't
work anywhere else.

To solve both of those issues, no longer return the URL from
get_resource and instead add a "query_str" attribute, which can be used
both for Aodh and likely other places. Also add a "project" attribute
and store it in the resource data.

Change-Id: Ib5a4091c1bcd39f113843ac60022307917a07804
Closes-Bug: #1645888
'}]
commit_message:
Don't return the signed queue URL from get_resource

A signed Zaqar queue URL is too long to fit as a physical resource ID.
The current queue URL is also very specific to Aodh, and likely won't
work anywhere else.

To solve both of those issues, no longer return the URL from
get_resource and instead add a "query_str" attribute, which can be used
both for Aodh and likely other places. Also add a "project" attribute
and store it in the resource data.

Change-Id: Ib5a4091c1bcd39f113843ac60022307917a07804
Closes-Bug: #1645888

commit_message:
Increase timeout for interfaces screen loading

Interfaces screen API was changed and a new API call was added
to fetch bond default attributes.
So, test time available for interfaces screen loading is increased
to make the test more stable.

Implements blueprint nics-and-nodes-attributes-via-plugin

Change-Id: I7190be21d7f232ed34631ea5682778dec2cf59cf

subject: Add subgraph execution support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-23 15:26:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-fuelclient/commit/2d90cc4704dd3bf216b0471cdea60f1ee16aac29', 'message': 'Add subgraph execution support

Add -S option to support subgraph execution. This would allow a user
to pick which tasks to stop on.

Example:

fuel2 graph execute -S keystone-db:openstack-controller/1

will start with all keystone-db tasks and end at openstack-controller at
node-1

DocImpact

Change-Id: I42f9caf2e9c18072a2ae0447df2ba3500f687d5e

commit_message:
Add subgraph execution support

Add -S option to support subgraph execution. This would allow a user
to pick which tasks to stop on.

Example:

fuel2 graph execute -S keystone-db:openstack-controller/1

will start with all keystone-db tasks and end at openstack-controller at
node-1

DocImpact

Change-Id: I42f9caf2e9c18072a2ae0447df2ba3500f687d5e
Closes-bug: 1612616
(cherry picked from commit e41e6511a9963f607c20aae2c12e1c04d1440c70)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-fuelclient refs/changes/14/401314/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: parser.add_argument('-S', '--subgraphs', type=str, nargs='+', required=False, help='List of subgraphs to execute' 'Format is: ' '[<start_task>[/<node_ids>]]\ [:<end_task>/[<node_ids>]]') 'subgraphs': parsed_args.subgraphs

commit_message:
Add environment parameter to collect-logs.sh

This will allow us to use the collect-logs CI script from different
environments, simplifying jobs that are not part of CentOS CI.

Change-Id: I13894a7de88f410e1446959c70911ef0f518cbaf

commit_message:
Fix for bug/1645473 -- test registered hooks

The issue was that TestRegisteredHooks.test_hooks didn't work for
functions that had multiple hook/when/etc. statements of the same kind.

This patchset fixes the bug and also fixes another bug in the same
file where patch_object() was ignoring the 'name' parameter.

Change-Id: I3a2213a870b40a6860718dfa32b5fa7c578c5f5d
Closes-Bug: #1645473

commit_message:
Fix placement of policy.json

Currently, policy.json is put in
"{{ node_config_directory }}/{{ service_name }}"
in target nodes.

Relocation policy.json to "{{ node_config_directory }}/{{ item }}"
with item is corresponding service compoment config directory.

Currently, the policy.json is copied to all services, but it
should be reviewed and left only in neccesary service
(at many cases, only API service needs that).

Redundant files will be removed in follow up patchset.

Change-Id: I0e997dccf4ec438c9c0436db71ec2fd06650f50d
Closes-Bug: #1639686
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/92/404092/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: dest: "{{ node_config_directory }}/{{ item }}/policy.json" with_items: - "heat-api" - "heat-api-cfn" - "heat-engine"

Currently storlets does not require swift for just installation,
so it does not affect container size so much.

 + tests      <- Fix sub directories based on the change in python directries

Previously, we had multiple packages, like storlet_middleware,
storlet_gateway and so on, in our storlets repository.
This patch integrates these packages into one package, to follow
general maneer of python packaging.

Also, this patch replaces previous install system using ant by
new install system using python setup.py.

(top directory)
 + bin          <- executable files
 + etc          <- configration samples
 + src          <- non-python codes
 |  + c         <- c codes
 |  | + sbus    <- Previously Engine/SBus/SBusTransportLayer
 |  + java      <- java codes
 |    + SBus    <- Previously Engine/SBus/SBusJavaFacade
 |    + SCommon <- Previously Engine/SBus/SCommon
 |    + SDaemon <- Previously Engine/SBus/SDaemon

Previously, we had multiple packages, like storlet_middleware,
storlet_gateway and so on, in our storlets repository.
This patch integrates these packages into one package, to follow
general maneer of python packaging.

Also, this patch replaces previous install system using ant by
new install system using python setup.py.

(top directory)
 + bin          <- executable files
 + etc          <- configration samples
 + src          <- non-python codes
 |  + c         <- c codes
 |  | + sbus    <- Previously Engine/SBus/SBusTransportLayer
 |  + java      <- java codes
 |    + SBus    <- Previously Engine/SBus/SBusJavaFacade
 |    + SCommon <- Previously Engine/SBus/SCommon
 |    + SDaemon <- Previously Engine/SBus/SDaemon
 + storlets     <- python codes.
 |  + agent
 |  | + daemon         <- Previously Engine/agent/storlet_daemon
 |  | + daemon_factory <- Previously Engine/agent/storlet_daemon_factory
 |  + gateway          <- Previously Engine/swift/storlet_gateway
 |  + sbus             <- Previously Engine/SBus/SBusPythonFacade
 |  + swift_middleware <- Previously Engine/swift/storlet_middleware
 |  + tools            <- Previously tools
 + tests        <- test codes
 + scripts      <- Previously Engine/SMScripts
 + install_libs.sh     <- Script used to build/install c/java codes
 + setup.cfg
 + setup.py

NOTE1:
Currently we have independent installation tool for c/java, as the
other existing OpenStack projects (ex. Monasca) does.

NOTE2:
Currently we install agent resources on host, but this is currently
kept to be used for our future plan to let containers use agent
resources by mounting it from host node.

storlet_gateway and so on, in our storlets repository.
This patch integrates these packages into one package, to follow
general manner of python packaging.

Also, this patch replaces previous install system using ant by
new install system using python setup.py.

(top directory)
 + bin          <- executable files
 + etc          <- configration samples
 + src          <- non-python codes
 |  + c         <- c codes
 |  | + sbus    <- Previously Engine/SBus/SBusTransportLayer
 |  + java      <- java codes
 |    + SBus    <- Previously Engine/SBus/SBusJavaFacade
 |    + SCommon <- Previously Engine/SBus/SCommon
 |    + SDaemon <- Previously Engine/SBus/SDaemon
 + storlets     <- python codes.
 |  + agent
 |  | + daemon         <- Previously Engine/agent/storlet_daemon
 |  | + daemon_factory <- Previously Engine/agent/storlet_daemon_factory
 |  + gateway          <- Previously Engine/swift/storlet_gateway
 |  + sbus             <- Previously Engine/SBus/SBusPythonFacade
 |  + swift_middleware <- Previously Engine/swift/storlet_middleware
 |  + tools            <- Previously tools
 + tests        <- test codes
 + scripts      <- Previously Engine/SMScripts
 + install_libs.sh     <- Script used to build/install c/java codes
 + setup.cfg
 + setup.py

NOTE1:
Currently we have an independent installation tool for c/java, as the
other existing OpenStack projects (ex. Monasca) do.

NOTE2:
Currently we install agent resources on host, but this is currently
kept to be used for our future plan to let containers use agent
resources by mounting it from host node.

TODO: Fix documents

Change-Id: Icdcafdf6e6d06917d715ad9a8cba45305613a6fb

'}, {'number': 45, 'created': '2016-10-07 15:38:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/storlets/commit/672c0926446d4d424a23a3d0e5cf879c8caa18a5', 'message': "Create storlets package

Previously, we had multiple packages, like storlet_middleware,
storlet_gateway and so on, in our storlets repository.
This patch integrates these packages into one package, to follow
general manner of python packaging.

Also, this patch replaces previous install system using ant by
new install system using python setup.py.

(top directory)
 + bin          <- executable files
 + etc          <- configration samples
 + src          <- non-python codes
 |  + c         <- c codes
 |  | + sbus    <- Previously Engine/SBus/SBusTransportLayer
 |  + java      <- java codes
 |    + SBus    <- Previously Engine/SBus/SBusJavaFacade
 |    + SCommon <- Previously Engine/SBus/SCommon
 |    + SDaemon <- Previously Engine/SBus/SDaemon
 + storlets     <- python codes.
 |  + agent
 |  | + daemon         <- Previously Engine/agent/storlet_daemon
 |  | + daemon_factory <- Previously Engine/agent/storlet_daemon_factory
 |  + gateway          <- Previously Engine/swift/storlet_gateway
 |  + sbus             <- Previously Engine/SBus/SBusPythonFacade
 |  + swift_middleware <- Previously Engine/swift/storlet_middleware
 |  + tools            <- Previously tools
 + tests        <- test codes
 + scripts      <- Previously Engine/SMScripts
 + install_libs.sh     <- Script used to build/install c/java codes
 + setup.cfg
 + setup.py

NOTE1:
Currently we have an independent installation tool for c/java, as the
other existing OpenStack projects (ex. Monasca) do. To install c/java
modules, run './install_libs.sh' at the top directory. It installs
required files under /usr/local/lib/storlets, so you may need root
privilege.

NOTE2:
We install agent resources also on host, but this is currently kept
to be used for our future plan to let containers use agent resources
by mounting it from host node.

NOTE3:
This patch also removes outdated ansible playbooks.

Change-Id: Icdcafdf6e6d06917d715ad9a8cba45305613a6fb

This patch integrates these packages into one package, to follow
general manner of python packaging.

Also, this patch replaces previous install system using ant by
new install system using python setup.py.

(top directory)
 + bin          <- executable files
 + etc          <- configration samples
 + src          <- non-python codes
 |  + c         <- c codes
 |  | + sbus    <- Previously Engine/SBus/SBusTransportLayer
 |  + java      <- java codes
 |    + SBus    <- Previously Engine/SBus/SBusJavaFacade
 |    + SCommon <- Previously Engine/SBus/SCommon
 |    + SDaemon <- Previously Engine/SBus/SDaemon
 + storlets     <- python codes.
 |  + agent
 |  | + daemon         <- Previously Engine/agent/storlet_daemon
 |  | + daemon_factory <- Previously Engine/agent/storlet_daemon_factory
 |  + gateway          <- Previously Engine/swift/storlet_gateway
 |  + sbus             <- Previously Engine/SBus/SBusPythonFacade
 |  + swift_middleware <- Previously Engine/swift/storlet_middleware
 |  + tools            <- Previously tools
 + tests        <- test codes
 + scripts      <- Previously Engine/SMScripts
 + install_libs.sh     <- Script used to build/install c/java codes
 + setup.cfg
 + setup.py

NOTE1:
Currently we have an independent installation tool for c/java, as the
other existing OpenStack projects (ex. Monasca) do. To install c/java
modules, run './install_libs.sh' at the top directory. It installs
required files under /usr/local/lib/storlets, so you may need root
privilege.

NOTE2:
We install agent resources also on host, but this is currently kept
to be used for our future plan to let containers use agent resources
by mounting it from host node.

NOTE3:
This patch also removes outdated ansible playbooks.

Change-Id: Icdcafdf6e6d06917d715ad9a8cba45305613a6fb

 + tests        <- test codes
 + scripts      <- Previously Engine/SMScripts
 + install_libs.sh     <- Script used to build/install c/java codes
 + setup.cfg
 + setup.py

other existing OpenStack projects (ex. Monasca) do. To install c/java

required files under /usr/local/lib/storlets, so you may need root
privilege.

to be used for our future plan to let containers use agent resources
by mounting it from host node.

NOTE3:
This patch also removes outdated ansible playbooks.

commit_message:
Create storlets package

Previously, we had multiple packages, like storlet_middleware,
storlet_gateway and so on, in our storlets repository.
This patch integrates these packages into one package, to follow
general manner of python packaging.

Also, this patch replaces previous install system using ant by
new install system using python setup.py.

(top directory)
 + bin          <- executable files
 + etc          <- configration samples
 + src          <- non-python codes
 |  + c         <- c codes
 |  | + sbus    <- Previously Engine/SBus/SBusTransportLayer
 |  + java      <- java codes
 |    + SBus    <- Previously Engine/SBus/SBusJavaFacade
 |    + SCommon <- Previously Engine/SBus/SCommon
 |    + SDaemon <- Previously Engine/SBus/SDaemon
 + storlets     <- python codes.
 |  + agent
 |  | + daemon         <- Previously Engine/agent/storlet_daemon
 |  | + daemon_factory <- Previously Engine/agent/storlet_daemon_factory
 |  + gateway          <- Previously Engine/swift/storlet_gateway
 |  + sbus             <- Previously Engine/SBus/SBusPythonFacade
 |  + swift_middleware <- Previously Engine/swift/storlet_middleware
 |  + tools            <- Previously tools
 + tests        <- test codes
 + scripts      <- Previously Engine/SMScripts
 + install_libs.sh     <- Script used to build/install c/java codes
 + setup.cfg
 + setup.py

NOTE1:
Currently we have an independent installation tool for c/java, as the
other existing OpenStack projects (ex. Monasca) do. To install c/java
modules, run './install_libs.sh' at the top directory. It installs
required files under /usr/local/lib/storlets, so you may need root
privilege.

NOTE2:
We install agent resources also on host, but this is currently kept
to be used for our future plan to let containers use agent resources
by mounting it from host node.

NOTE3:
This patch also removes outdated ansible playbooks.

Co-Authored-By: Eran Rom <eran@itsonlyme.name>
Change-Id: Icdcafdf6e6d06917d715ad9a8cba45305613a6fb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/storlets refs/changes/32/370332/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: '''------------------------------------------------------------------------- Copyright IBM Corp. 2015, 2016 All Rights Reserved Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and Limitations under the License. -------------------------------------------------------------------------''' import sys import zipfile from cluster_config_parser import ClusterConfig from utils import get_auth, deploy_storlet CLS_SUFFIX = '.class' def list_classes(storlet_jar): with zipfile.ZipFile(storlet_jar, 'r') as zfile: for f in zfile.infolist(): name = f.filename if name.endswith(CLS_SUFFIX): print('\t* ' + name[:-len(CLS_SUFFIX)].replace('/', '.')) def usage(): print("Useage: deploy_storlet.py <path to conf>") def main(argv): if len(argv) != 1: usage() return -1 conf = ClusterConfig(argv[0]) url, token = get_auth(conf) sys.stdout.write("Enter absolute path to storlet jar file: ") storlet_jar = sys.stdin.readline().rstrip() print("Your jar file contains the following classes:") list_classes(storlet_jar) sys.stdout.write("Please enter fully qualified storlet main class " + "(choose from the list above): ") storlet_main_class = sys.stdin.readline().rstrip() print("Please enter dependency jars (leave a blank line when you are " "done):") dependency_jars = [] dependency_jar = sys.stdin.readline().rstrip() while dependency_jar: dependency_jars.append(dependency_jar) dependency_jar = sys.stdin.readline().rstrip() deploy_storlet(url, token, storlet_jar, storlet_main_class, dependency_jars) print("Storlet deployment complete") return 0 if __name__ == "__main__": sys.exit(main(sys.argv[1:]))

Instead of "from i18n import _ 
            from i18n import _LE"
this style "from i18n import _, _LE" is recommended as following:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#real-world-import-order-examples

'}]
commit_message:
Set import exceptions in tox.ini configuration

Instead of "from i18n import _ 
            from i18n import _LE"
this style "from i18n import _, _LE" is recommended as following:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#real-world-import-order-examples
but the pep8 failed: H301 one import per line
so it needs to set import exceptions in tox.ini to avoid the problem

Change-Id: I615a5416d12d74ab13eb51e4279214aaf402747d

commit_message:
Switch to python-freezerclient

freezer-web-ui needs to be switched to python-freezerclient
in the same way as freezer. freezer.apiclient is no longer
available.

Change-Id: Icba3e628f7b1e9305b556609bf55676a776ecfa5
Implements: blueprint switch-to-python-freezer-client
Closes-Bug: #1643950
Signed-off-by: Ruslan Aliev <raliev@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Publish governance-website content

Now that the docroot uses /srv/static/tc, publish the neutral
openstack/governance-website content to /srv/static/governance.

This is step 6 in setting up a neutral governance website,
following the plan described in [1].

[1]
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack-infra/infra-specs/specs/neutral-governance-website.html

Change-Id: I0f1989f2013f0edf30296cc02b25d7666ccf19e6

subject: Disable devstack plugin for builder 'ironic-grenade'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-29 23:47:42.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/ironic.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/b5a66da86219c0a7af8d91f2df3697f2898dfaee', 'message': "Disable devstack plugin for builder 'ironic-grenade'

Disable the devstack plugin for items which use the 'ironic-grenade'
builder as the grenade plugin in Ironic already enables the devstack
plugin. If the devstack plugin is enabled twice it gets run twice
which will have it attempting to create the bare-metal VMs twice and
failing.

Create a new builder: 'ironic-vars-early' as the ordering is
important.  Previously we had a bug because ordering was changed and
the ironic plugin was enabled after the ironic-inspector plugin. Work
around this issue by using this new ironic-vars-early builder.

Change-Id: I6b4c2b1c3149a185d0495ed6f7674e173614f63b
"}]
commit_message:
Disable devstack plugin for builder 'ironic-grenade'

Disable the devstack plugin for items which use the 'ironic-grenade'
builder as the grenade plugin in Ironic already enables the devstack
plugin. If the devstack plugin is enabled twice it gets run twice
which will have it attempting to create the bare-metal VMs twice and
failing.

Create a new builder: 'ironic-vars-early' as the ordering is
important.  Previously we had a bug because ordering was changed and
the ironic plugin was enabled after the ironic-inspector plugin. Work
around this issue by using this new ironic-vars-early builder.

Change-Id: I6b4c2b1c3149a185d0495ed6f7674e173614f63b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/79/404479/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: name: ironic-vars-early builders: - shell: | cat << 'EOF' >> ironic-vars-early {script} EOF - builder: - ironic-vars-early: script: | # NOTE(jlvillal): export not needed for this as used within devstack-virtual-ironic # We disable the devstack plugin because the grenade code in Ironic # enables it and enabling it twice causes errors. IRONIC_DISABLE_DEVSTACK_PLUGIN=1 # Ensure the ironic-vars-EARLY file exists touch ironic-vars-early # Pull in the EARLY variables injected by the optional builders source ironic-vars-early if [[ -z "$IRONIC_DISABLE_DEVSTACK_PLUGIN" && "$ZUUL_BRANCH" != "stable/liberty" ]] ; then # Ensure the ironic-EXTRA-vars file exists # Pull in the EXTRA variables injected by the optional builders
deleted_lines: if [[ "$ZUUL_BRANCH" != "stable/liberty" ]] ; then # Ensure the ironic-extra-vars file exists # Pull in the extra variables injected by the optional builders

commit_message:
Nova: Skip grenade-dsvm-neutron-multinode-live-migration on stable/newton

As with bug#1642543 any attempt to run a Xenial based grenade job
against Newton will result in a failure during the initial Mitaka
install.

Change-Id: I8e22dca06941e4f5d1b06ac7cc58ca544517c0bb
Closes-bug: #1646127
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/03/404803/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: branch: ^(?!stable/(liberty|mitaka|newton)).*$

subject: Relax JSON input validation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-28 11:28:43.000000000', 'files': ['src/js/components/utils/Formsy.js'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ui/commit/537618fed2c393cb1fbc0b52f40951dd66e3373c', 'message': "Relax JSON input validation

Currently the JSON form input validator only passes if the value is a
valid JSON string. This doesn't accout for cases where a paramater
doesn't need to be set. This patch relaxes the validation rule so it
also allows the value to be an empty string.

Change-Id: I4d135120ac3041b223986eef8f54c4de24f20379
Closes-Bug: #1645266
"}]
commit_message:
Relax JSON input validation

Currently the JSON form input validator only passes if the value is a
valid JSON string. This doesn't accout for cases where a paramater
doesn't need to be set. This patch relaxes the validation rule so it
also allows the value to be an empty string.

Change-Id: I4d135120ac3041b223986eef8f54c4de24f20379
Closes-Bug: #1645266
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ui refs/changes/34/403634/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: /* * The field is valid if the current value is either empty * or a valid JSON string. */ Formsy.addValidationRule('isJson', (values, value, otherField) => { try { return value === '' ? true : !!JSON.parse(value); }

commit_message:
Support default-config-dirs with oslo.config

This is a backport from oslo.config master (see
I4df977911539777d1510e8b579375aca5b5f15f4) to support default
config directories.
This is needed because some projects switched to only support WSGI
environment and with that it is no longer possible to add custom
--config-dir parameters when starting the service.

Note: This patch will automatically land in master with the next
oslo.config release. That's why this is not a cherry-pick from master.

Change-Id: If12d8fe7b7a8bdfa47a805db892ef03a94e4a737
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rpm-packaging refs/changes/76/405176/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
hacking: Use uuidutils to generate UUID

Added hacking check to ensure that UUIDs are not generated
by uuid4() since we should do this using oslo_utils.uuidutils.

Based on this nova change [1].

[1] I73ee63fbd4f451d3aa5dc1a2a734d68c308b4440

Change-Id: Ic7783c29fbd838c827ccc8ee44aa757fef8e9169
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/22/397322/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_check_uuid4(self): code = """ fake_uuid = uuid.uuid4() """ errors = [(1, 0, 'M354')] self._assert_has_errors(code, checks.check_uuid4, expected_errors=errors) code = """ hex_uuid = uuid.uuid4().hex """ self._assert_has_no_errors(code, checks.check_uuid4)

commit_message:
Switch experimental upgrade jobs to multinode

In order to start the work on N to O major upgrade with
scenario, we need to switch experimental major upgrade
job to multinode.

Change-Id: I597d1cacacdaa55f5c7016ccce1fae86af31fe20

subject: Remove useless vnc proxy url params
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-07 04:05:14.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/compute.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_compute_spec.rb', 'manifests/vncproxy.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova/commit/9863d4b613bdd88578d856b2746e2aa8b5cb6ea3', 'message': 'Remove useless vnc proxy url params

Remove vnc proxy related params in nova::compute and nova::vncproxy.
These params are now configured in nova::vncproxy::common.

Change-Id: I99bb35c9f037f6888b69b5d4c3e4edb74b1fee0d
'}]
commit_message:
Remove useless vnc proxy url params

Remove vnc proxy related params in nova::compute and nova::vncproxy.
These params are now configured in nova::vncproxy::common.

Change-Id: I99bb35c9f037f6888b69b5d4c3e4edb74b1fee0d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/49/394249/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Show team and repo badges on README
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-25 13:44:23.000000000', 'files': ['README.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/training-labs/commit/5eae1d351b13ad998ac3b811833d9d4062858db3', 'message': "Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

b'https://gist.github.com/1fbfcab8fd3e4a9e9d5819b48dd7499c\n'

Change-Id: I2f2b1c6baaa5ff33a8b9ddc073eb691714267536
"}]
commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

b'https://gist.github.com/1fbfcab8fd3e4a9e9d5819b48dd7499c\n'

Change-Id: I2f2b1c6baaa5ff33a8b9ddc073eb691714267536
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-labs refs/changes/05/402605/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ======================== Team and repository tags ======================== .. image:: http://governance.openstack.org/badges/training-labs.svg :target: http://governance.openstack.org/reference/tags/index.html .. Change things from this point on

commit_message:
oslo.messaging: make rabbit job voting again

The rabbit job have moved 8 months to non-voting because
all functional tests was 'instable'. The rabbit one have always
worked fine. The pika and zmq have been fixed a while ago.

This change re-enables it for all branches.

Change-Id: Ibbac5ff89defee9023984aa65e5d375147a655c6

commit_message:
Add note about python-db jobs

Add a note that python-db jobs are not really needed anymore and should
get replaced by using tools/test-setup.sh

See also:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Change-Id: I0dc82dff02a606a43c07670def472b8cd3cdb09a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/97/402397/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This is the legacy way of setting up databases. Projects should now # add tools/test-setup.sh to their repositories and use the normal # python-jobs instead.

commit_message:
Merge install and deploy guide scripts

The two scripts do the same, just have one different parameter. Use a
single script and rename it.

The scripts are included directly in yaml and do not life anymore in the
scripts directory so that changes to them will be directly and don't
need new images to be built.

Change-Id: Ia229b118daabb1f43da1507a37a4fd3724c2512a

commit_message:
Migrate device_owner for router's interface

When migrating a HA router to legacy, the router's interface (whose
device_owner is network:ha_router_replicated_interface) isn't changed
to network:router_interface. This means that certain actions (such as
trying to use 'neutron router-interface-delete' and migrating the router
to DVR) won't work (since a router interface of the appropriate type
can't be found and an SNAT port won't be created, respectively). This
patch takes care of the needed migration.

Closes-Bug: #1645716
Change-Id: I0c18ccf08ddfa57fde9b5ac331101497079bd330
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/15/404215/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_migration_from_ha(self): router = self._create_router() self.assertTrue(router['ha']) network_id = self._create_network(self.core_plugin, self.admin_ctx) subnet = self._create_subnet(self.core_plugin, self.admin_ctx, network_id) interface_info = {'subnet_id': subnet['id']} self.plugin.add_router_interface(self.admin_ctx, router['id'], interface_info) router = self._migrate_router(router['id'], False) for port in router.attached_ports.all(): self.assertEqual(constants.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_INTF, port.port_type)

commit_message:
Port ironic unit tests to Python 3

* Use sorted(dict.keys()) because dict.keys() has no sort() method
  on Python 3

* Dicts are not orderable in Python 3, need work around. For more
  information, please see:
  http://stackoverflow.com/questions/22333388/dicts-are-not-orderable-in-python-3

Partially-Implements: blueprint goal-python35

Co-Authored-By: Davanum Srinivas <davanum@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Icf7fd0e392fc0d174d6312badf024367ba72fd8f

commit_message:
Fixes undercloud-tokenflush validation

undercloud-tokenflush validation was getting
passed even with commented-out entry in crontab file.
This patch ensures that validation will get fail
with commeted-out entry.

Closes-Bug: #1643814

Change-Id: Ie61244b32d10ad31e93c585eebe8367bcee1d6b4
Signed-off-by: Vikrant Aggarwal <ervikrant06@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations refs/changes/88/404688/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: shell: 'crontab -l -u keystone | grep -v "^#"'

commit_message:
elements: pip-and-virtualenv: Add python-xml dependency

SUSE packages the 'xml' python module as a separate package so make
sure it's pulled in before we attempt to install the pip module
since the latter depends on it. Fixes the following problem when
building with the opensuse-minimal and pip-and-virtualenv elements:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/tmp/get-pip.py", line 19177, in <module>
    main()
  File "/tmp/get-pip.py", line 194, in main
    bootstrap(tmpdir=tmpdir)
  File "/tmp/get-pip.py", line 82, in bootstrap
    import pip
  File "/tmp/tmpOiESjX/pip.zip/pip/__init__.py", line 16, in <module>
  File "/tmp/tmpOiESjX/pip.zip/pip/vcs/subversion.py", line 9, in <module>
  File "/tmp/tmpOiESjX/pip.zip/pip/index.py", line 32, in <module>
  File "/tmp/tmpOiESjX/pip.zip/pip/_vendor/html5lib/__init__.py", line 16, in <module>
  File "/tmp/tmpOiESjX/pip.zip/pip/_vendor/html5lib/html5parser.py", line 6, in <module>
  File "/tmp/tmpOiESjX/pip.zip/pip/_vendor/html5lib/inputstream.py", line 10, in <module>
  File "/tmp/tmpOiESjX/pip.zip/pip/_vendor/html5lib/utils.py", line 10, in <module>
ImportError: No module named xml.etree.ElementTree

Change-Id: I1bec12dfcde05fb07f41bcec994148c3eacbb287

commit_message:
Add option to reindex notification-less plugins

Add an option --notification-less to 'searchlight-manage index sync' to
re-sync only plugins that don't have notifications.

Implement blueprint: reindex-interval

Change-Id: Ie87af603144f071de5fe47a62e245520d8ddf775
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/searchlight refs/changes/89/394489/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: To reindex resources without notifications periodically each <integer> seconds:: $ searchlight-manage index sync --interval <integer>

commit_message:
Resolves a bug in the Tempestexception import error

Troveclient tempest test reports a problem with the
TempestException[1],I looked at the code and found that all
Tempestexception from tempest.lib.exception, rather than tempest.exception
[2] [3], so changes it.

[1]:http://logs.openstack.org/57/405057/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-python-troveclient/0879817/console.html#_2016-12-01_03_13_13_296142

[3]:https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/tests/lib/test_base.py#L19

subject: Port test_metadata to Python 3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-17 05:27:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a789f5633c1b6f9faf1d3ee1447daa37723894e2', 'message': 'Port test_metadata to Python 3

* convert_password(): on Python 3, decode password from UTF-8 if it
  is a byte string
* convert_password(): don't modify password in the loop body, use an
  index increased at each iteration. This is a minor cleanup,
  unrelated to Python 3.
* ec2_md_print() now returns byte strings unchanged. On Python 3,
  str(bytes) uses "b'...'" format which is not the expected result
  (or it raises a BytesWarinng exception when using python3 -bb).
* Replace the base64 module with oslo_serialization.base64 to control
  the output type (bytes or text) on Python 2 and Python 3.
* _make_cache_key(): on Python 3, don't encode the host to UTF-8.
  Python 3 requires text.
* MetadataRequestHandler: on Python 3, encode HTTP body to UTF-8 if
  the body type is Unicode.
* test_metadata:

  - encode hmac.new() parameters using encodeutils.to_utf8()
  - use response.text rather than response.body to compare with
    Unicode string
  - use a byte strings for the instance identifier
  - fix some Unicode versus bytes issues

* tests-py3.txt: run test_metadata on Python 3

Co-Authored-By: Davanum Srinivas <davanum@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Victor Stinner <vstinner@redhat.com>
Partially-Implements: blueprint goal-python35

Change-Id: Ifb43ce164d9fd80f9f85c95c762d7b010e84dfeb

commit_message:
Port test_metadata to Python 3

* convert_password(): on Python 3, decode password from UTF-8 if it
  is a byte string
* convert_password(): don't modify password in the loop body, use an
  index increased at each iteration. This is a minor cleanup,
  unrelated to Python 3.
* ec2_md_print() now returns byte strings unchanged. On Python 3,
  str(bytes) uses "b'...'" format which is not the expected result
  (or it raises a BytesWarinng exception when using python3 -bb).
* Replace the base64 module with oslo_serialization.base64 to control
  the output type (bytes or text) on Python 2 and Python 3.
* _make_cache_key(): on Python 3, don't encode the host to UTF-8.
  Python 3 requires text.
* MetadataRequestHandler: on Python 3, encode HTTP body to UTF-8 if
  the body type is Unicode.
* test_metadata:

  - encode hmac.new() parameters using encodeutils.to_utf8()
  - use response.text rather than response.body to compare with
    Unicode string
  - use a byte strings for the instance identifier
  - fix some Unicode versus bytes issues

* tests-py3.txt: run test_metadata on Python 3

Co-Authored-By: Davanum Srinivas <davanum@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: ChangBo Guo(gcb) <eric.guo@easystack.cn>
Partially-Implements: blueprint goal-python35

Change-Id: Ifb43ce164d9fd80f9f85c95c762d7b010e84dfeb

Fix project_id show in 'senlin xyz_list -g'

subject: Show team and repo badges on README
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-25 16:38:23.000000000', 'files': ['README.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tricircle/commit/4640b52531f4d6feeaa20eb5b6a6591a724ffb87', 'message': "Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.

commit_message:
Fix resource update issues

Currently when updating a resource, the 'id' is not allowed to be
in the request body, openstacksdk is can not checking whether 'ID'
is legal or not. So pass an object to openstacksdk to get through.

Change-Id: I3b52ef9ceaa75ab28c3bb52a314b044fa51e6dda

commit_message:
Use Neutron's entry points to extend OVSDB Connection

New entry points were added to Neutron that allow the usage of OVSDB
connection to be more flexible. This change takes advantage of that.

Change-Id: I52961b0ee7977b1324eca083887d9cbb7f8f5382
Depends-On: I48339059f399aeb5e16e6038f0a5d00deffe3fcd

commit_message:
Enable sorting by size in containers pane

The containers module was using an incorrect ID in the "Size" column,
preventing the user from sorting by "Size". This change updates the
ID s/size/bytes/ which is the resource property holding the actual object size
in Bytes.

This change also updates the default "subdir" size to 0, that is the
default value returned in the "Content-Length" header for "subdirectories"

Change-Id: I98d164ec1a08d15f25fcdbc92f45e46c9fa6e5c4
Closes-bug: 1643710

commit_message:
Change wait_until_true's default exception to subclass Exception

wait_until_true's implementation uses eventlet.timeout.Timeout, which
raises an eventlet.timeout.Timeout excpetion on timeout. However, this
exception subclasses BaseException and not Exception, and is not caught
by python's testing framework. This change verifies the raised exception
subclasses Excpetion, which is caught by the testing framework.

Change-Id: I6b7727508ca4bbab220dc3c45fadafd7aeb968e1

Raises a TestTimeoutException after timeout seconds, polling once every sleep seoncds. """ exception = exception or TestTimeoutException return n_utils.wait_until_true(predicate, timeout, sleep, exception) wait_until_true(internal_predicate, timeout, sleep, exception) wait_until_true(internal_predicate, timeout, sleep, exception)

commit_message:
Enable firewalld [+Docs]

This patch allows deployers to opt-in for firewalld. The firewalld package
is installed and the service is enabled when `security_enable_firewalld` is
set to `yes`.

Documentation is included.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: I641a8c7e468ed1b7908d2b62296fa309de6979b5

commit_message:
Disable ctrl-alt-del key sequence [+Docs]

This patch masks the systemd unit that controls the C-A-D key sequence.

commit_message:
Expire cached sssd authenticators [+Docs]

This patch provides tasks and docs to implement the following STIGs:

  - RHEL-07-010400
  - RHEL-07-010401
  - RHEL-07-010402

The tasks will not run if the sssd configuration file is not present.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: Iddf850b8ccd72871beba4644b765e33e6d3c968b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/33/403833/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Set a timeout (in seconds) to cache NSS authenticators with sssd. security_nss_cached_authenticator_timeout: 86400 # RHEL-07-010400 # Set a timeout (in days) to cache PAM/ssh authenticators with sssd. security_pam_offline_credentials_expiration_days: 1 # RHEL-07-010401 / RHEL-07-010402
